DOCNAME: CASE OF SÜLEYMAN ERKAN v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 3 (substantive aspect);Violation of Art. 3 (procedural aspect)
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;David Thór Björgvinsson;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE at TIME the applicant was arrested by police officers from the anti - terror branch of ORG on suspicion of membership of an illegal organisation , the ORG ( ORG Party ) . According to the arrest protocol , the police officers had to use force to apprehend the applicant since he resisted the arrest . The applicant refrained from signing this document . The applicant alleged that , contrary to what was indicated in the arrest protocol , he had been arrested on DATE .

CARDINAL . Following his arrest , the applicant was blindfolded , put in a car and threats were uttered against him . After being driven around for some time , still blindfolded , he was taken to the anti - terror branch of ORG . There , the applicant was allegedly punched , kicked , beaten on the head and the back with a truncheon and threatened with death . He also alleged that his testicles were squeezed .

CARDINAL . On DATE at TIME the applicant was examined by a doctor in ORG who noted an ecchymosis of CARDINAL x QUANTITY on the left of the lower part of his abdominal region . The doctor concluded that there were marks of physical violence on the applicant 's body and considered that he should be examined by an urologist . On DATE at TIME the applicant was examined by an urologist who found , by using the technique of palpation , that the applicant 's testicles were painful and sensitive .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was again examined by a general practitioner in ORG who considered that the applicant should be taken to an internist . According to the report drawn up by the doctor , the applicant was brought to him as he was on a hunger strike in police custody . The applicant was then taken back to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was again examined by a general practitioner in ORG who noted that the applicant was brought before him because of hunger strike . The doctor considered that the applicant should be examined by an internist . On DATE , the applicant underwent a blood test .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a doctor in ORG who noted that there was no sign of physical violence on his body .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was brought before the public prosecutor at ORG . In his statement , he maintained that he had been subjected to ill - treatment while in police custody and that , therefore , he had started a hunger strike . Subsequently , on DATE , the applicant was brought before the investigating judge at ORG . Before the judge , the applicant maintained that he had been kept in police custody for DATE and that he had been subjected to ill - treatment during custody . He further denied the accusations against him . The judge ordered the applicant 's release as there was no strong evidence demonstrating that he had committed the offences of which he was accused .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a complaint with the PERSON public prosecutor 's office against the police officers from the anti - terror branch of ORG , who had allegedly ill - treated him . In his petition , the applicant maintained that he had been arbitrarily deprived of his liberty DATE and that he had been subjected to ill - treatment while in police custody . He further contended that on DATE of his detention in police custody he had fainted due to ill - treatment and that he awoke in ORG . He finally maintained that on DATE the doctor had drawn up the medical report without examining him .

CARDINAL . Upon receipt of the applicant 's petition , on DATE the PERSON public prosecutor took a statement from the applicant who reiterated his complaints and requested that the police officers who had illtreated him be punished . The public prosecutor then requested the doctor at ORG to examine the applicant and submit a medical report .

CARDINAL . Still on DATE , the applicant was examined by a medical expert from ORG , who observed CARDINAL scarred incisions of QUANTITY each on his nose and on his left heel , a scarred incision of QUANTITY on his left elbow and an ecchymosis of QUANTITY on his abdominal region .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by CARDINAL medical experts from ORG who noted the following marks and considered that the applicant 's account of events was consistent with the marks observed on his body :

“ ... a scabbed wound of CARDINAL x QUANTITY on the left elbow , a scabbed wound of CARDINAL x QUANTITY on the right side of the lower lip , an old wound of QUANTITY in diameter on the forehead , a scabbed wound on the left heel , a dark brown ecchymosis of QUANTITY on the left lower part of the sternum , haemorrhage on the upper part of the external part of the outer ear .... ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor issued a decision of lack of territorial jurisdiction and sent the investigation file to the PERSON public prosecutor 's office .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE respectively the PERSON public prosecutor took statements from CARDINAL police officers who were on duty at the anti - terror branch of ORG at the time of the applicant 's detention in police custody . The first officer PERSON contended that he had signed the document containing the applicant 's statements but had not participated in the questioning . He denied the allegations against him . He further maintained that there had been no need to torture the applicant as the security forces had already found several organisational documents of the ORG in his house . The second officer , GPE , denied the accusation and claimed that members of illegal organisations generally made this kind of false accusation . He further contended that the minor marks mentioned in the medical report of DATE did not result from torture . He alleged that they might have been the marks resulting from handcuffing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor took a statement from the applicant , who reiterated his allegations and emphasised that he had been arrested on DATE , although the date on the arrest protocol was DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor issued a decision not to prosecute in respect of the police officers . He found that there was no evidence other than the applicant 's allegations on which to initiate criminal proceedings against the police officers .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an objection against the decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's objection . This decision was served on the applicant 's lawyer on DATE .
